byline.contributor: This article is by Tom Robbins of The Marshall Project, a nonprofit news organization that focuses on criminal justice issues.

abstract: Interviews with inmates at Mid-State Correctional Facility outside of Utica, NY, reveal guards severely beat over 30 prisoners in July in retaliation for injury to guard Nicholas Kahl; state officials say they are investigating incident and have suspended prison's top two officials; allegations of brutality against inmates are latest involving state prisons.
lead_paragraph: Prisoners at Mid-State Correctional Facility near Utica, N.Y., say they were punched and kicked and had their heads slammed in a door and through a wall by officers who blamed two inmates for the injury.

headline.main: ‘I Was Terrified’: Inmates Say They Paid a Brutal Price for a Guard’s Injury
headline.print_headline: Brutal Price Paid for Guard’s Injury, Inmates Say
